Tic-Tac-Toe is a two-player game played on a 3x3 grid. Players take turns placing their mark, X or O, in an empty square. The first player to place three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game. You will play as player 1, therefore you play with X while your adversary plays with the symbol O. Your input is then a number (from 0 to 2) for the row followed by a space and another number (from 0 to 2) for the column, nothing else.
Random wins by default due to LLM's repeated invalid moves.

The first player to place three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game. You will play as player 1, therefore you play with X while your adversary plays with the symbol O. Your input is then a number (from 0 to 2) for the row followed by a space and another number (from 0 to 2) for the column, nothing else.
